content:
MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON: low volatility environment (Vol: 14.7%) with broad participation (Breadth 7/8 sectors positive). Market backdrop favors cyclicals and risk assets.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Energy & Chemicals leading: GUBRF (1W: +9.86% | 1M: +23.47%) ABOVE TREND and TUPRS (1W: +8.88% | 1M: +22.91%) ABOVE TREND. Retail & Food also strong: CCOLA (1W: +10.60% | 1M: +17.97%) ABOVE TREND and ULKER (1W: +6.71% | 1M: +17.16%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Transportation is the clear laggard with mixed internals: PGSUS (1W: -0.89% | 1M: -6.86%) BELOW TREND and TAVHL (1W: -0.85% | 1M: +6.31%) CORRECTION. Technology & Telecom shows some divergence: KONTR (1W: -1.87% | 1M: -22.57%) BELOW TREND.

STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
ASELS (1W: +16.22% | 1M: +59.52%) ABOVE TREND; CCOLA (1W: +10.60% | 1M: +17.97%) ABOVE TREND; GUBRF (1W: +9.86% | 1M: +23.47%) ABOVE TREND; TUPRS (1W: +8.88% | 1M: +22.91%) ABOVE TREND; TRMET (1W: +7.32% | 1M: +23.05%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
SISE (1W: -0.51% | 1M: +0.41%) CORRECTION; GARAN (1W: -0.61% | 1M: +3.38%) CORRECTION; TSKB (1W: -0.75% | 1M: +1.53%) CORRECTION; TAVHL (1W: -0.85% | 1M: +6.31%) CORRECTION; PGSUS (1W: -0.89% | 1M: -6.86%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Biggest 1W movers: ASELS (1W: +16.22% | 1M: +59.52%) ABOVE TREND, CCOLA (1W: +10.60% | 1M: +17.97%) ABOVE TREND, GUBRF (1W: +9.86% | 1M: +23.47%) ABOVE TREND, TUPRS (1W: +8.88% | 1M: +22.91%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +7.32% | 1M: +23.05%) ABOVE TREND.

SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banks trading higher but mixed internals; AKBNK (1W: +4.97% | 1M: +8.91%) ABOVE TREND and VAKBN (1W: +5.70% | 1M: +10.05%) ABOVE TREND lead while GARAN (1W: -0.61% | 1M: +3.38%) CORRECTION and ISCTR (1W: -1.23% | 1M: +2.78%) CORRECTION show short-term profit taking. Overall positive but monitor loan growth and NIM sensitivity to FX.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry showing broad strength: EREGL (1W: +2.15% | 1M: +4.56%) ABOVE TREND, FROTO (1W: +2.08% | 1M: +8.02%) ABOVE TREND and ASELS (1W: +16.22% | 1M: +59.52%) ABOVE TREND lead while ARCLK (1W: -1.78% | 1M: +2.32%) CORRECTION and TKFEN (1W: -3.24% | 1M: -3.26%) BELOW TREND are watchlist names.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy remains the clearest thematic trade: TUPRS (1W: +8.88% | 1M: +22.91%) ABOVE TREND, GUBRF (1W: +9.86% | 1M: +23.47%) ABOVE TREND and TRMET (1W: +7.32% | 1M: +23.05%) ABOVE TREND outperform; SISE (1W: -0.51% | 1M: +0.41%) CORRECTION lags but overall sector quant scores top the market.

PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
In this RISK-ON, low-volatility regime overweight Energy & Chemicals, Retail and selective Heavy Industry names while trimming Transportation and weak Tech. Maintain disciplined stops on names that are CORRECTION or BELOW TREND and scale into momentum leaders on confirmation.

NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
ASELS (1W: +16.22% | 1M: +59.52%) ABOVE TREND for continuation or profit-taking; TUPRS (1W: +8.88% | 1M: +22.91%) ABOVE TREND on oil moves; GUBRF (1W: +9.86% | 1M: +23.47%) ABOVE TREND for sector flows; CCOLA (1W: +10.60% | 1M: +17.97%) ABOVE TREND for retail demand.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Energy & Chemicals for momentum and macro sensitivity, Retail & Food for domestic consumption resilience, and Heavy Industry for cyclicals and export dynamics. Watch transportation for any micro catalysts that could reverse its lag.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Monitor XU100 responsiveness to TL FX moves, CBRT commentary and inflation prints, and global oil prices as primary triggers; domestic catalysts include earnings releases and bank loan data. Tactical risk: any pickup in volatility above ~25% would shift regime and warrant immediate de-risking.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
RISK-ON market with low volatility and broad sector participation favors cyclicals: Energy, Retail and Heavy Industry leading. Key opportunity is riding momentum names (ASELS, TUPRS, GUBRF) while managing exposure to Transportation and names in CORRECTION/BELOW TREND.
